oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Poynor Chairs
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space; Performing Identity
Artists; Work
Chairs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two chairs made by Dick Poynor, an African American craftsman. .

Dick Poynor was born into slavery in Virginia in 1802, and moved to Williamson County in 1816. He obtained his freedom between 1850 and 1860. He operated a chair factory on his farm in western Williamson County. He and his son, James, produced hundreds of chairs during their careers.
